lineage_mutations(pango_lin, mutation, freq)¶

outbreak_data.lineage_mutations(pango_lin, mutation=None, freq=0.8, server='api.outbreak.info', auth='Bearer 0ed52bbfb6c79d1fd8e9c6f267f9b6311c885a4c4c6f037d6ab7b3a40d586ad0')¶

Retrieves data from all mutations in a specified lineage above a frequency threshold.

Parameters:

  • pango_lin (str or list[str]) – (Required) A string or list; loads data for all mutations in a specified PANGO lineage. List of lineages separated by OR. List of mutations can be added as, Lineage 1 OR Lineage 2 OR Lineage 3 AND Mutation 1 AND Mutation 2.

  • mutation (str or list[str]) – (Optional) A string or list; loads intersecting mutation data for sequences classified under specified PANGO lineages with those mutations

  • freq (float) – (Optional, default = 0.8) A number between 0 and 1 specifying the frequency threshold above which to return mutations

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame

Example usage:¶
     foo = lineage_mutations('b.1.1.7')
Mutiple queries for lineages and mutations can be separated by “,”¶
     Ex:  foo = lineage_mutations('b.1.1.7, b.2, ay.2')
Use ‘OR’ in a string to return overlapping mutations in multiple lineages.¶
     Ex:  foo = lineage_mutations('ba.2 OR b.1.1.7')

cases_by_location(location)

prevalence_by_location(location, startswith)
